input: user: Craft a farewell message from a lover going to war.
coverage:
Oh, dearest heart, as I to battle fly,  
Lend me thy hand one last, sweet, soft embrace,  
For parting thus doth pierce mine own heart's eye,  
And leaves me bound by memory's gentle grace.  

The trumpet sound bids me into the fray,  
Where courage falters not on fields of dread.  
Yet fret not, love, for fleeting is the day  
When triumph leads me safe to our shared bed.  

Keep watch o'er thy heart, my truest delight,  
As stars keep vigil 'pon the ebon night.  
Though we must severed be by war's dark might,  
Our souls doth bind with love’s immortal light.  

In dreams, I’ll cross the spanning gulf of time,  
And whisper sonnets sweet into thy sleep.  
Till fate returns me, thus in rhythm’d rhyme,  
My soul e'er thine to hold and e’er to keep.  

Farewell, mine own sweet rose, till fortune’s wheel  
Doth turn our tethered hearts of iron and steel.
